Graph: Find connected components of a gr: Tree: Inorder sucessor in BT with parent pointer
BFS/DFS O(V + E), keep track of componen: If right subtree of node is not NULL, successor in minimum of right subtree. Else then succ is one of the ancestors. Travel up using the parent pointer until you see a node which is left child of it’s parent. The parent of such a node is the succ. O(h)

Graph: Find connected components of a gr: Tree: Inorder sucessor in BST without parent pointer
BFS/DFS O(V + E), keep track of componen: Search from root O(h). Instead of traveling up with parent pointers: Travel down the tree, if a node’s data is greater than root’s data then go right side, otherwise go to left side.

Graph: Find connected components of a gr: Tree: k-th highest element of BST
BFS/DFS O(V + E), keep track of componen: reverse inorder traversal of BST. O(h + k)

The master serves reads and writes, replicating writes to one or more slaves, which serve only reads. Slaves can also replicate to additional slaves in a tree-like fashion. If the master goes offline, the system can continue to operate in read-only mode until a slave is promoted to a master or a new master is provisioned.
Both masters serve reads and writes and coordinate with each other on writes. If either master goes down, the system can continue to operate with both reads and writes.
(or functional partitioning) splits up databases by function. For example, instead of a single, monolithic database, you could have three databases: forums, users, and products
distributes data across different databases such that each database can only manage a subset of the data.
attempts to improve read performance at the expense of some write performance. Redundant copies of the data are written in multiple tables to avoid expensive joins.
is a collection of data items represented in a key-value store, document-store, wide column store, or a graph database. Data is denormalized, and joins are generally done in the application code.
